googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* For the November 3, 2020 election, every registered voter will receive an absentee ballot application in the mail.
* Any registered Massachusetts voter request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a Massachusetts driver's license or state ID card.  If not, you can register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Massachusetts driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Massachusetts you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Massachusetts
  * be 18 years old on or before the next election
  * not have been convicted of corrupt practices in respect to elections
  * not be under guardianship with respect to voting
  * not be currently incarcerated for a felony conviction
